cause.description:
Hydrocephalus blocks the natural drainage of fluid from the head. As the fluid builds up, it puts pressure on the brain. The pressure at first affects a child's sight, then their motor functions, and finally their intellectual development.
1. Hydrocephalus is one of the most common “birth defects.”
2. It afflicts in excess of 10,000 babies each year in the US, and many times that in developing countries. More than 50% of hydrocephalus cases are congenital.
3. As many as 75% of children with hydrocephalus will have some form of motor disability.
